field.label: Search input selector
field.comment:
DOM selector of search input field.

Important!: Edit only if your custom theme changes the default search input ID!

field.label: Use Searchanise for full-text search
field.comment:
Disable in case of invalid search operation.
The instant search widget will remain active.

field.label: Sync mode
field.comment:
Select When catalog updates to keep track of catalog changes and index them automatically.
Select Periodically via cron to index catalog changes every day in at 3 o'clock in the morning. You can read how to configure a cron here
Select Manually to index catalog changes manually by clicking FORCE RE-INDEXATION button in the Searchanise control panel (Catalog → Searchanise).

field.label: Use indexing queue
field.comment:
When set to 'Yes', all synchronization operations will be performed via magento indexer.

To schedule the run searchanise queue you need to add the code to your crontab:
*/1 * * * * php /bin/magento indexer:reindex searchanise_queue

field.label: Use prices for usergroups
field.comment: If disabled, prices for customer usergroups will NOT be indexed. It may increase indexation speed significantly.

field.label: Use direct images links
field.comment:
When set to ‘Yes’, Searchanise will index full size images instead of thumbnails. It may help decrease indexation time and avoid some server side issues occurring during thumbnail generation. But it may also increase widget loading time on frontend.

Important!: Catalog should be re-indexed on Catalog->Searchanise page after changes.

field.label: Description attribute
field.comment:
Select an attribute to use as product description for indexation to display in Searchanise widgets.

Important!: Catalog should be re-indexed on Catalog->Searchanise page after changes

field.label: Render page templates
field.comment:
When set to ‘Yes’ , CMS page template custom variables like '{{config path="web/unsecure/base_url"}}' will be rendered and indexed.

Important!: Catalog should be re-indexed on Catalog->Searchanise page after changes.
